info.name: Savvy Bee Api V1
info.description:
Live api Link

https://savvy-bee-backend-nodejs-express-mongodb.onrender.com

Demo api Link

https://savvy-bee-backend-nodejs-express-mongodb.onrender.com

Testing Api and Handle Error

Error from api are validated and should be passed to frontend

try{
  await axios({
  ...
  })
}catch(error){
  ...
  error.response.data.message
}

Status Code

  • 200/300: You are safe

  • 500: you have a server error.

  • 400: Bad Request

  • 401: Unauthorized request

  • 402: Payment required

  • 403: Forbiden request.

  • 404: Page Not Found.

Encryption body

Some request do require encryptions if intigrating with React native, use the below code an ask dev for encrption key. Also insall crypto-js package to use it

import CryptoJS from 'crypto-js';
import { ALERT_TYPE, Toast } from 'react-native-alert-notification';
const SECRET_KEY = 'key'; // Must be 32 characters long
/**
 * Encrypts a string using AES encryption
 * @param {string} text - The text to encrypt
 * @param {string} key - The encryption key (must be 32 characters long)
 * @returns {string} The encrypted string in base64 format
 */
export function encrypt(text, key = SECRET_KEY) {
    console.log(SECRET_KEY.length);
    if (key.length !== 32) {
        throw new Error('Key must be 32 characters long');
    }
    const encrypted = CryptoJS.AES.encrypt(text, CryptoJS.enc.Utf8.parse(key), {
        mode: CryptoJS.mode.CBC,
        padding: CryptoJS.pad.Pkcs7,
        iv: CryptoJS.enc.Utf8.parse(key.substring(0, 16)) // Using the first 16 characters as IV
    });
    return encrypted.toString();
}
/**
 * Decrypts an AES encrypted string
 * @param {string} encryptedText - The encrypted text in base64 format
 * @param {string} key - The decryption key (must be 32 characters long)
 */
export function decrypt(encryptedText, key = SECRET_KEY) {
    if (key.length !== 32) {
        Toast.show({
            title:"Error occured. Enc-dcy",
            textBody:'Kindly contact admin',
            type:ALERT_TYPE.DANGER
        })
        return null
    }
    try {
        const decrypted = CryptoJS.AES.decrypt(encryptedText, CryptoJS.enc.Utf8.parse(key), {
            mode: CryptoJS.mode.CBC,
            padding: CryptoJS.pad.Pkcs7,
            iv: CryptoJS.enc.Utf8.parse(key.substring(0, 16))
        });
        const decryptedText = decrypted.toString(CryptoJS.enc.Utf8);
        return decryptedText || null; // Return null if decryption results in an empty string
    } catch (error) {
        console.error('Decryption failed:', error.message);
        Toast.show({
            title:"Error occured. Enc-dcy",
            textBody:'Kindly contact admin',
            type:ALERT_TYPE.DANGER
        })
        return null
    }
}

while for React use this:

import CryptoJS from 'crypto-js';
const SECRET_KEY = 'kllop975ghjko8uhjydfgbjk997123lk'; // Must be 32 characters long
/**
 * Encrypts a string using AES encryption
 * @param {string} text - The text to encrypt
 * @param {string} key - The encryption key (must be 32 characters long)
 * @returns {string} The encrypted string in base64 format
 */
export function encrypt(text, key = SECRET_KEY) {
    if (key.length !== 32) {
        throw new Error('Key must be 32 characters long');
    }
    const encrypted = CryptoJS.AES.encrypt(text, CryptoJS.enc.Utf8.parse(key), {
        mode: CryptoJS.mode.CBC,
        padding: CryptoJS.pad.Pkcs7,
        iv: CryptoJS.enc.Utf8.parse(key.substring(0, 16)) // Using the first 16 characters as IV
    });
    return encrypted.toString();
}
/**
 * Decrypts an AES encrypted string
 * @param {string} encryptedText - The encrypted text in base64 format
 * @param {string} key - The decryption key (must be 32 characters long)
 */
export function decrypt(encryptedText, key = SECRET_KEY) {
    if (key.length !== 32) {
        alert("Error occured. Enc-dcy")
        return null
    }
    try {
        const decrypted = CryptoJS.AES.decrypt(encryptedText, CryptoJS.enc.Utf8.parse(key), {
            mode: CryptoJS.mode.CBC,
            padding: CryptoJS.pad.Pkcs7,
            iv: CryptoJS.enc.Utf8.parse(key.substring(0, 16))
        });
        const decryptedText = decrypted.toString(CryptoJS.enc.Utf8);
        return decryptedText || null; // Return null if decryption results in an empty string
    } catch (error) {
        console.error('Decryption failed:', error.message);
        alert("Error occured. Enc-dcy")
        return null
    }
}

{
    "success": true,

        "allchat": [

            {

                "UserId": "68f121caabb0b65c17237b79",
                "From": "ai",
                "Message": "Hi Trevor! Youre Trevor Mandela. Its lovely to see youhow can I support you with your finances today?",

            },
            {

                "From": "ai",
                "Message": "Ive got you, Trevor. Right now your wallet balance is NGN 0. No USD account is set up yet.\n\nIf youd like to add money, the quickest way is a bank transfer to your NGN account:\n- Account Name: Savvy_ Trevor Mandela\n- Account Number: 1110031244\n- Bank: Test Bank\n\nTransfers typically reflect within a few minutes, but can take a little longer depending on the bank network.\n\nTell me how youd like me to direct you next:\n- Add funds: How much do you want to deposit? Ill guide you step-by-step.\n- Plan before money arrives: I can set a simple micro-plan for your next inflow (needs, savings, wants) so youre ready.\n- Specific goal: Paying a bill, saving for something, or tracking spending this week?\n\nYoure not alonewell take this one small step at a time. What would you like to do first?",
                "createdAt": "2025-10-22T13:34:21.627Z",
                "updatedAt": "2025-10-22T13:34:21.627Z",
                "__v": 0
            },
            {
                "_id": "68f8ddd2b3ea589368c22bab",
                "UserId": "68f121caabb0b65c17237b79",
                "From": "user",

                "createdAt": "2025-10-22T13:36:18.420Z",
                "updatedAt": "2025-10-22T13:36:18.420Z",
                "__v": 0
            },
            {
                "_id": "68f8ddd2b3ea589368c22bad",
                "UserId": "68f121caabb0b65c17237b79",
                "From": "ai",
                "Message": "You got it, Trevor. Your first question was: hello whats my name?\n\nStill up for guidance? Pick one and Ill handle the rest:\n- Add funds now (Ill resend your transfer details).\n- Set a simple plan for your next deposit (e.g., 50% essentials, 30% savings, 20% wants  adjustable).\n- Create a specific goal or bill to prepare for.\n\nWhich one feels right?",
                "createdAt": "2025-10-22T13:36:18.589Z",
                "updatedAt": "2025-10-22T13:36:18.589Z",
                "__v": 0
            },
            {
                "_id": "68f8de24b3ea589368c22bb4",
                "UserId": "68f121caabb0b65c17237b79",
                "From": "user",
                "Message": "I am expecting 300k soon and its from a contract how do you think I can manage it",
                "createdAt": "2025-10-22T13:37:40.480Z",
                "updatedAt": "2025-10-22T13:37:40.480Z",
                "__v": 0
            },
            {
                "_id": "68f8de24b3ea589368c22bb6",
                "UserId": "68f121caabb0b65c17237b79",
                "From": "ai",
                "Message": "Love that youre planning ahead, Trevorthats a strong move. Since this is contract income, lets protect it first, then spend with intention. Heres a simple safetyfirst plan for NGN 300,000:\n\n- 20% Taxes  NGN 60,000\n  Keep this separate. If your client deducts withholding tax, well adjust.\n- 15% Business/Operations  NGN 45,000\n  For tools, data, transport, and to fund the next gig.\n- 15% Emergency fund  NGN 45,000\n  Build a cushion for quiet months.\n- 35% Living essentials  NGN 105,000\n  Rent, food, transport, utilities.\n- 10% Goals/Sinking funds  NGN 30,000\n  Upcoming bills (rent top-up, school fees, phone, etc.).\n- 5% Fun/Flex  NGN 15,000\n  Guiltfree spending so you dont feel strained.\n\nWant me to set this up as auto-allocation the moment the 300k lands? If yes, Ill create labeled pots and move the amounts instantly so your essentials and savings are protected.\n\nYour NGN account to receive the funds:\n- Account Name: Savvy_ Trevor Mandela\n- Account Number: 1110031244\n- Bank: Test Bank\n\nQuick checks so I can tailor it perfectly:\n1) Will any withholding tax be taken from this payment? (If yes, how much?)\n2) Do you have any urgent bills or debt due this month?\n3) Would you prefer to swap the 10% Goals for 10% Investing insteador split it?\n\nIf you say Yes, set it up, Ill auto-allocate exactly as above and keep your tax and savings out of harms way. Weve got thisone smart step at a time.",
                "createdAt": "2025-10-22T13:37:40.643Z",
                "updatedAt": "2025-10-22T13:37:40.643Z",
                "__v": 0
            },
            {
                "_id": "68f8def462ebffd1172fdf46",
                "UserId": "68f121caabb0b65c17237b79",
                "From": "user",
                "Message": "Omo its remote and I dont pay tax for now, but omo lets get on",
                "createdAt": "2025-10-22T13:41:08.744Z",
                "updatedAt": "2025-10-22T13:41:08.744Z",
                "__v": 0
            },
            {
                "_id": "68f8def462ebffd1172fdf48",
                "UserId": "68f121caabb0b65c17237b79",
                "From": "ai",
                "Message": "Got you, Trevor. Since no tax set-aside for now, heres a clean plan for the NGN 300,000 landing soon:\n\n- Emergency fund  20% = NGN 60,000\n- Business/Operations (data, tools, power)  15% = NGN 45,000\n- Living essentials  35% = NGN 105,000\n- Goals/Sinking funds  10% = NGN 30,000\n- Investing/Skill growth  10% = NGN 30,000\n- Buffer for surprises  5% = NGN 15,000\n- Fun/Flex  5% = NGN 15,000\n\nWhy this works: it protects you first (emergency + buffer = 25%), keeps operations funded for the next gigs, and still gives room for growth and guiltfree spending.\n\nWant me to set up these 7 pots and autoallocate the moment the 300k hits your Savvy NGN account (1110031244  Test Bank)? Say Yes, set it up.\n\nQuick tweaks (optional):\n- If income is very irregular, we can bump Emergency to 25% and take 5% from Fun/Goals.\n- If you have an urgent bill, Ill shift from Buffer/Fun to cover it.\n\nTiny headsup: remote income can still be taxable depending on rules. If that changes later, well spin up a Tax pot in seconds. For now, your 5% Buffer quietly covers surprises.\n\nHow would you like to proceedset it up as is, or adjust any percentages?",
                "createdAt": "2025-10-22T13:41:08.946Z",
                "updatedAt": "2025-10-22T13:41:08.946Z",
                "__v": 0
            },
            {
                "_id": "68f8df3b62ebffd1172fdf4f",
                "UserId": "68f121caabb0b65c17237b79",
                "From": "user",
                "Message": "Nothing for now but you too de typw much you no fit speak pidgin",
                "createdAt": "2025-10-22T13:42:19.761Z",
                "updatedAt": "2025-10-22T13:42:19.761Z",
                "__v": 0
            },
            {

                "Message": "No wahala, Trevor. I fit yarn Pidgin. Sorry say I type long beforeI'll keep am short now.\n\nNice one as you don plan ahead. When the 300k land, how you wan make we run am?\n- A) Auto-split am like we plan\n- B) Waitremind me first before we split\n- C) Adjust the percentages\n\nJust reply A, B, or C. And make I keep replies short like this going forward? (Yes/No) We dey together.",
                "createdAt": "2025-10-22T13:42:19.907Z",
                "updatedAt": "2025-10-22T13:42:19.907Z",
                "__v": 0
            }
        ]
    }
}

request.description:
use the below code to help you with the main flowchart on the dashboard

void main() {
  final transactions = [
    {
      "id": "664f080293b88c7cb32d227f",
      "type": "debit",
      "amount": 20000,
      "narration": "AirtimeALATMTN2347062625859 348232666852",
      "balance": null,
      "date": "2024-05-23T09:43:32.267Z",
      "category": null
    },
    {
      "id": "664f080293b88c7cb32d2280",
      "type": "credit",
      "amount": 20000,
      "narration": "ALAT NIP TRANSFER TO GLOBUS BANK-Mono-txd_7kt6nuk",
      "balance": null,
      "date": "2024-05-14T12:07:45.767Z",
      "category": null
    },
    // ... add more transactions
  ];

  // 1 Initialize monthly summary (JanDec)
  final months = List.generate(12, (i) {
    final monthName = [
      'Jan', 'Feb', 'Mar', 'Apr', 'May', 'Jun',
      'Jul', 'Aug', 'Sep', 'Oct', 'Nov', 'Dec'
    ][i];
    return {
      'month': monthName,
      'credit': 0,
      'debit': 0,
      'net': 0,
    };
  });

  // 2 Group and sum by month
  for (var tx in transactions) {
    final date = DateTime.parse(tx['date']);
    final monthIndex = date.month - 1;
    final type = tx['type'];
    final amount = tx['amount'] as int;

    months[monthIndex][type] = (months[monthIndex][type] as int) + amount;
  }

  // 3 Compute net inflow (credit - debit)
  for (var m in months) {
    m['net'] = (m['credit'] as int) - (m['debit'] as int);
  }

  print(months);
}
